content.description:
Aeneas on the Hunt

Ipse ante alios pulcherrimus omnes 
infertinfero, -ferre: to present se socium Aeneas atque agmina iungitiungo, -ere: to join. 
Qualis ubi hibernamhibernus, -a, -um, adj.: wintry LyciamLycia, -ae, f.: Lycia (a region in Asia Minor) XanthiXanthus, -i, m.: Xanthus (a river in Troy)que fluentafluentum, -i, n. = flumen, -inis 
deserit ac DelumDelus, -i, f.: Delos (an island in the Aegean sea) maternammaternus, -a, -um, adj.: maternal invisitinviso, -ere = visito, -are Apollo.
content.question: The simile in lines 3-4 (Qualis...Apollo) emphasizes Aeneas’s

unit.text: 6: Course Project and Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry
